results.title: Frontier: stories from white Australia's forgotten war: part three: the government should shut its eyes 1860-1938 (A)
results.brief_description: The final part in the ‘Frontier’ series moves North to Queensland where Aboriginal resistance is high. An estimated ten thousand Aborigines lose their lives in the resistance with the law of the day, the Colonial Government, seemingly turning a blind eye. In the face of these massacres, forced assimilation and breeding out, Aborigines started to organise politically and informed white Australia they had no intention of dying out.
results.title_for_label: Frontier: stories from white Australia’s forgotten war: part three: the government should shut its eyes 1860-1938 (A)

results.title: Frontier: stories from white Australia's forgotten war: part one: they must always consider us as enemies 1788-1830 (A)
results.brief_description: Soldier/Administrator David Collins, arriving in Sydney on the First Fleet is acknowledged as being the first official to acknowledge there is tension between blacks and whites in their struggle over the land. Fighting ends temporarily in Tasmania after a verbal treaty is reached acknowledging partial rights to Aborigines over the land. The Government quickly breaks this verbal promise however and the Aborigines flee into exile.

results.title: Frontier: stories from white Australia's forgotten war: part one: they must always consider us as enemies 1788-1830 (A)
results.brief_description: Designed for the international market, this is a compilation of the 3 complete episodes screened on television and contained in the collection, with the addition of some footage that wasn’t televised on ABC- the overall effect is somewhat sanitised and apologetic.

results.title: Frontier college
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover and Julian Biggs
results.brief_description: How adult education is brought to the railway and logging camps of Canada’s hinterland. The film tells how university students every summer become “one of the gang” in order to help new immigrants and “old” Canadians acquire some of the knowledge which will enrich their future lives. We are introduced to the founder of Frontier College, Dr. E.W. Bradwin, and witness the experiences of one volunteer who spends his holidays doing double duty as railway section hand by day and teacher by night.

results.title: From the tropics to the snow
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Stanley Hawes, Malcolm Otton, R. Mason and J Lee
results.brief_description: A tourist film of Australia. It is not a travelogue but a story combining humour with selling and entertainment with information; highlighting the difficulties of a producer, director and script-writer in the making of a short film which is to show all the tourist attractions of Australia. The film gently (and not so gently) laughs at all those aspects of the Australian way of life that are usually included in films about Australia, and also shows some of the not so well known attractions of the country. (Awards: Gold Award, Travel Category; Australian National Travel Association’s “Jedda Award”; Kodak Silver Award for colour photography, Australian Film Awards, 1965).

results.title: From the hut (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre, Lee Wright and Ron Verson
results.brief_description: Observes the creative activities of children with logs, boards, ropes, sticks and planks as they solve, in the setting of an adventure playground, all manner of mathematical and physical problems. No narration. Filmed at Warrandyte South Primary School. Suitable for tertiary and teacher level.

results.title: From the heart of America
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, Kenneth Baldwin and James Woolley
results.brief_description: The memorial services for the late President Eisenhower following his death in March 1969. Shows the funeral caisson moving along Constitution Avenue, the services in the Rotunda and the Washington national Cathedral and the funeral train heading west to Abilene, Kansas. Excerpts from President Nixon’s eulogy are heard.

results.title: From the ground up
results.brief_description: A film designed to show Britain’s efforts to expand her productive capacity in industry, farming and all other spheres of her national life. Implicit in the film is the idea that present austerity is essential to future prosperity.

results.title: From the files of the R.C.M.P.: file 1365 - the Connors case
results.brief_description: This dramatization of the real-life murder of a salesman from Regina, Saskatchewan, shows the methods used by the Royal Canadian Mounted Police to catch the criminal. Voice and narration: John Drainie
